reference.shortdesc:
The steps-unordered element contains a set of unordered steps. Unordered steps are steps in which the order of the steps to be performed might vary from one situation to another.Suggeston: "The steps-unordered element contains a set of steps in which the order of the steps to be performed might vary from one situation to another."
Kris Eberlein, 26 October 2022
Already changed to "Unordered steps are steps in which the order of the steps to be performed might vary from one situation to another."

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The steps-unordered element is specialized from ul. It is defined in the task module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how an author provided information about the tasks that need to be performed before leaving on a vacation. While each step involves a single item, the steps can be performed in any order.
example.codeblock: <task id="prep-for-trip"> <title>Preparing for a trip</title> <taskbody> <steps-unordered> <step> <cmd>Arrange for a pet sitter</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Do laundry</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Buy a plane ticket</cmd> </step> </steps-unordered> </taskbody> </task>
